text:
Pablo and his little sister, Deborah, are at a carnival. The carnival has several Ferris wheels for cildren of different ages. The two largest wheels, for older chidlren, take 60 seconds and 50 seconds to complete one revolution. The four smaller wheels tke 30, 20, 14, and 11 seconds to complete one revolution.

Pablo gets on at the bottom of a large Ferris wheel. Deborah gets on at the bottom of a small Ferris wheel. The rides begin at the same time.

For each ride,

  • How many seconds will pass before Pablo and Deborah are both at the bottom again?
  • How many times will each Ferris wheel have gone around?

The 60- and 20- Second Ferris Wheels

Pablo gets on the 60- second Ferris wheel, and Deborah gets on the 20-second Ferris wheel.

The 50- and 30- second Ferris Wheels

Pablo gets on the 50-second Ferris wheel, and Deborah gets on the 30-second Ferris wheel.

The 14- and 11- Second Ferris Wheels

For fun, Pablo gets on the ride for young people that takes 14 seconds to complete a revolution, and Deborah gets on the ride that takes 11 seconds.
